Cache¶

class Cache¶

Bases: werkzeug.contrib.cache.RedisCache

A custom implementation of werkzeug’s RedisCache. This modifies and adds a few functions to RedisCache. All keys are automatically lowercased. Cache key get/set/inc/del accesses are logged in a global variable for debugging purposes.

cache_model(model, timeout=None)¶

Cache a SQLAlchemy model. Does nothing when model is None.

Parameters:
  • model – The model we want to cache
  • timeout (Optional[int]) – The number of seconds to persist the cached value for
Return type:

Optional[str]
Returns:

The cache key of the model
cache_models(models, timeout=None)¶

Cache a SQLAlchemy model. Does nothing when model is None.

Parameters:
  • model – The model we want to cache
  • timeout (Optional[int]) – The number of seconds to persist the cached value for
Return type:

None
Returns:

The cache key of the model
delete(key)¶

Delete key from the cache.

Parameters:key (str) – The key to delete
Return type:bool
Returns:Whether or not the key existed and has been deleted
delete_many(*keys)¶

Delete multiple keys from the cache.

Parameters:keys (str) – The keys to delete
Return type:bool
Returns:Whether or not all keys have been deleted
get(key)¶

Look up the key in the cache and return the value for it.

Parameters:key (str) – The key to be looked up
Return type:Any
Returns:The value if it exists and is readable, else None
get_dict(*keys)¶

Look up multiple keys in the cache and return their values for it.

Parameters:keys (str) – The keys to be looked up
Return type:Optional[dict]
Returns:The values if they exist and are readable, else None
has(key)¶

Look up the key in the cache and return whether or not it exists.

Parameters:key (str) – The key to be looked up
Return type:bool
Returns:The value if it exists and is readable, else None
inc(key, delta=1, timeout=None)¶

Increment a cache key if it exists, otherwise create it and optionally set a timeout.

Parameters:
  • key (str) – The cache key to increment
  • delta (int) – How much to increment the cache key by
  • timeout (Optional[int]) – If the cache key is created in this request, it will be persisted for this many seconds
Return type:

Optional[int]
Returns:

The new value of the key, or None in the event of a backend error
init_app(app)¶
Return type:None
set(key, value, timeout=None)¶

Add a new key/value to the cache (overwrites value, if key already exists in the cache).

Parameters:
  • key (str) – The key to set
  • value (Union[int, str, list, dict]) – The value for the key
  • timeout (Optional[int]) – The cache timeout for the key in seconds (if not specified, it uses the default timeout). A timeout of 0 indicates that the cache never expires.
Return type:

bool
Returns:

True if key has been updated, False for backend errors. Pickling errors, however, will raise a subclass of pickle.PickleError.
set_many(mapping, timeout=None)¶

Add multiple new key/value pairs to the cache (overwrites value, if key already exists in the cache).

Parameters:
  • mapping (Dict[str, Any]) – The key/value pairs to set
  • timeout (Optional[int]) – The cache timeout for the key in seconds (if not specified, it uses the default timeout). A timeout of 0 indicates that the cache never expires.
Return type:

bool
Returns:

True if all the keys have been updated, False for errors
ttl(key)¶

Return the time to live (time until expiry) for a cache key.

Parameters:key (str) – The cache key to check for expiry
Return type:int
Returns:The seconds left until a key expires
clear_cache_dirty(session, _, __)¶

Clear the cache key of every dirty/deleted object before DB flush.

Parameters:session (SignallingSession) – The database session about to be committed
Return type:None
